articles.title: New DNA evidence may expose infamous murderer Jack the Ripper
articles.description: Jack the Ripper, the notorious serial killer who terrorized the streets of London more than a century ago, may have finally been identified by forensic scientists in Great Britain.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Powerball jackpot jumps to $550 million
articles.description: There was no Powerball winner Saturday, upping Wednesday's estimated jackpot to $550 million -- or a lump sum payout of $335 million. The odds of winning are 1 in 292 million.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: 1,000 feared dead after cyclone hits Mozambique's main port city
articles.description: More than a 1,000 people are feared dead after a cyclone swept through Mozambique in east Africa. Tens of thousands of people were cut off from roads and telephones in mainly poor, rural areas

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Midwest braces for more rain as deadly and historical flooding devastates the region
articles.description: The Midwest is bracing for more rain in the coming days as it continues to deal with record-breaking flooding that has killed at least three people. The floods were triggered by heavy rains and melting snow. A dozen states are currently under flood watches an…

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: ISIS vows to keep fighting as final battle in Syria drags on
articles.description: The battle for the last scrap of land held by ISIS has taken longer than expected. The terror group is vowing to fight to the last man in Baghouz. Charlie D'Agata reports from Syria.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: New Zealand's prime minister promises new gun laws after mosque attack
articles.description: In the wake of a deadly attack on a mosque in New Zealand, the country's prime minister promised to quickly introduce new gun laws. She was one of several officials who received a manifesto from the suspect just as the attack began. Ben Tracy reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Suspect in deadly Netherlands tram shooting arrested
articles.description: A suspect was arrested in a shooting that left three people dead and five wounded in the Netherlands. After the shooting, a massive manhunt ensued. Roxana Saberi reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Meghan McCain hits back after Trump's Twitter attack on her father
articles.description: A bitter feud between the president and the family of John McCain is back in the spotlight. The time it started with a tweet and spilled over into network TV. Major Garrett reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: DNA tech leads to arrest in 1999 slayings of teen best friends
articles.description: Authorities in southeast Alabama say they used emerging DNA technology to arrest 45-year-old Coley McCraney in the 1999 killings of J.B. Beasley and Tracie Hawlett, both 17. CBS affiliate WTVY has the story.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Insurance loophole leaves patients stuck with unexpected bills
articles.description: Medical debt is the leading cause of banktuptcy in the U.S. and a recent survey found 57 percent of American adults have received a surprise medical bill. Oftentimes it's for  treatment they later learned was "out of network." Mireya Villarreal explains.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Dick Dale, "The King of Surf Guitar," dead at 81
articles.description: Guitarist Dick Dale, who was known for songs like "Miserlou," has died. He was 81 years old. "CBS Evening News" anchor Jeff Glor takes a look back at his life.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Twins head to March Madness thanks to a major assist from mom
articles.description: College basketball players will be battling it out during March Madness. But there's a pair of twins who have already beaten the odds, thanks in no small part to their mom. "CBS Evening News" anchor Jeff Glor has their story.

articles.description: The dance team Wizdom (you have to be at least 50 to join) is showing fans you are only as old as you feel
